definition: to fall/to tumble/to trip/(of prices etc) to drop/Taiwan pr. [die2]

sentences.english: In the downdraft from a commodity sell-off, the dollar would be the perverse winner.
sentences.chinese: 随着商品证券跌价，美元将会成为胜之不武的赢家。

sentences.english: His house is falling in price.
We could reduce our price by 5% if you place a substantial order with us.
sentences.chinese: 要是你们定货量大的话，我们可以跌价5%。

sentences.english: The risk, of course, is that the forint devalues or depreciates.
sentences.chinese: 风险当然是福林贬值或跌价。

sentences.english: The prices of BW TV sets have gone down.

definition: (coll.) to fall or drop in price/to go down in price
to cut the price/to drive down the price/to get cheaper
merchandise or commodities available immediately after sale/merchandise in stock/available item/actuals (investment)/actual commodities
to appreciate (in value)/to increase in price
property or cash held in reserve/stock
(of a price) to fluctuate according to the market/to sell at the market price
